column2: Form a de Jure kingdom of the Reach
The lands of the Reach have been divided for centuries. If we claw these lands from the Nords and Bretons, we can form our own kingdom.
2 Kings of Skyrim with a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
A High King of Skyrim with a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
An Emperor with some lands in Skyrim with a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
2 Kings of High Rock with a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
The High King of High Rock with a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
An Emperor with some lands in High Rock with a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
Characters with high enough diplomacy (§Y>= 20§!) can convince the rulers of High Rock and Skyrim to recognize the Reach as an independent region.
Every province in the Reach shares your §Y[Root.Culture.GetName]§! culture.
Characters with high enough martial (§Y>= 20§!) can enforce their rule over the Reach by converting all the provinces in the region to their culture.
The Elder Council can also vote on the matter.
Claim Red Eagle's Fury
Claim the weapon of Faolan, Red Eagle's Fury.
Claim the Armor of the Old Gods
Claim the armor blessed by the Witchmen of the Reach, the Armor of the Old Gods.
Honor Faolan's legacy
The legends of the Reach say that when our lands are finally free, Faolan will come back and lead us.
The Reach is completely liberated, and under your control.
The other powers of Tamriel have been forced to recognize the Reach as a proper de Jure Kingdom.
An alliance has been formed between the Hagravens and yourself.
And when our people are safe and our land free, lay my sword by my side, and I shall lead the Reachmen once again to glory.
Reforge Red Eagle's Fury into Red Eagle's Bane, the true form of the sword.
Seek a Hagraven Coven
Seek a Hagraven Coven, in search for power...
Vassalize the High Crone
In your quest to unite the Reach, having most of the Hagraven covens by your side could prove useful. By offering them protection and lands, we can expect having them support our conquests and rule.
The High Crone has a high enough (§G50§!) opinion of you.
The county of §YHraggen§! is directly owned by you or the High Crone
The county of §YScarhammer§! is directly owned by you or the High Crone
The county of §YIronheim§! is directly owned by you or the High Crone
The High Crone becomes your vassal.
The High Crone is granted the Duchy of Scarhammer, and every county in it she doesn't already have.
Vassalize the Chosen of the Old Gods
The Chosen of the Old Gods have protected the Reach for many years. But it is time for them to acknowledge their rightful ruler.
§Y[d_chosenoldgods.Holder.GetTitledName]§! has an opinion of §G25§! or higher of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
Vassalize the Forsworn
The Forsworn have protected the Reach for many years. But it is time for them to acknowledge their rightful ruler.
§Y[d_forsworn.Holder.GetTitledName]§! has an opinion of §G25§! or higher of §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!
Break the Reach
The Reach was part of High Rock and Skyrim for centuries, but recently clawed its independence from both kingdoms. It is time to put this abomination down, and subjugate these lands once again.

The de Jure kingdom of the Reach will be broken, the duchies being awarded back to their former de Jure kingdoms.\n\nAmbitious rulers will be able to form the Breton Empire and the Nordic Empire once more.
Integrate Haafingar into the Reach
While the lands of Haafingar are part of Skyrim, they are close enough from our border to let us claim it as another part of the Reach.
Integrate Falkreath into the Reach
While the lands of Falkreath are part of Skyrim, they are close enough from our border to let us claim it as another part of the Reach.
Integrate Dorven into the Reach
While the lands of Dorven are part of High Rock, they are close enough from our border to let us claim it as another part of the Reach.
Integrate Evermore into the Reach
While the lands of Evermore are part of High Rock, they are close enough from our border to let us claim it as another part of the Reach.
Carve an Empire in the Reach

With no place to call home, the [Root.Culture.GetName] led by [Root.GetTitledName] carved their own in the fertile lands of the Reach. But to be known as a force to be feared, a true Empire of their own has to be formed. The lands of the Nords and the Bretons are ripe for another conquest.
High Kingdom of the Reach

For centuries the lands of the Reach have been without a powerful leader, or any kind of policital unity. Bretons and Nords, backed by Imperial armies, carved the Reach and made sure that it would not be a threat to their power ever again.
Nevertheless, these lands have been inhabited by Reachmen and Orcs, people who, without a home to call theirs, made the Reach a fertile ground for ambitious rulers and people.
[Root.GetTitledName] is one of these people, and in a powerful move officially proclaimed the High Kingdom of the Reach, centuries after Reman carved it.
The Reach is now as strong politically as High Rock, Skyrim, or Cyrodiil.
Hopefully this will bring peace and stability to a troubled region.
The Reach will be its own de Jure Kingdom.\n\nAs long as the de Jure Reach exists, the Nordic and Breton Empire cannot be formed.

[From.GetTitledName], in a strong political move, officially proclaimed the High Kingdom of the Reach, taking lands that were given to High Rock and Skyrim by Reman and giving them back their own identity.\nWhat will happen next is uncertain, but the Reach is now as strong politically as High Rock, Skyrim, or even Cyrodiil.
An interesting development...
Create a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach

Put forward a bill to create a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach, with the duchies of §YThe Reach§!, §YBleakwind§!, §YScarhammer§!, §YVolskygge§!, §YSunderstone§!, §YJehenna§!, §YFarrun§! and §YDunkarn§! leaving their respective kingdom.

[From.GetElderCouncilRank] [From.GetFirstName] has proposed to let the Reach be its own kingdom, meaning the duchies of §YThe Reach§!, §YBleakwind§!, §YScarhammer§!, §YVolskygge§!, §YSunderstone§!, §YJehenna§!, §YFarrun§! and §YDunkarn§! would be de Jure vassals of §YThe Reach§!. As [Root.GetTitle], it is your right to veto the proceedings and kill the motion before it is voted on.

A meeting of the Elder Council has been called to vote on whether the Reach be its own kingdom, meaning the duchies of §YThe Reach§!, §YBleakwind§!, §YScarhammer§!, §YVolskygge§!, §YSunderstone§!, §YJehenna§!, §YFarrun§! and §YDunkarn§! would be de Jure vassals of §YThe Reach§!. Everyone is in attendance and ready to vote.
I read to bill to the other councillors.

[target_proposer.GetElderCouncilRank] [target_proposer.GetFirstName] has put forward a bill to let the Reach be its own kingdom, meaning the duchies of §YThe Reach§!, §YBleakwind§!, §YScarhammer§!, §YVolskygge§!, §YSunderstone§!, §YJehenna§!, §YFarrun§! and §YDunkarn§! would be de Jure vassals of §YThe Reach§!.
The Council has voted in favour of creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally]
The Council has voted against creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally]
The Council has not reached a consensus on creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally] As High Chancellor, it falls to you to break the tie.
Very well.
The Elder Council has voted in favour of creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally]
The Elder Council has voted in favour of creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally]
reach_flavour.6 has experience an error, please keep this save and report this if you see it! [GetECVoteTally]
Very well.
The Elder Council has voted against creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally]
The Elder Council has against creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach. [GetECVoteTally]
reach_flavour.7 has experience an error, please keep this save and report this if you see it! [GetECVoteTally]
Very well.
[From.GetTitledName] has vetoed the proceedings of the Elder Council in the middle of its debate concerning creating a de Jure Kingdom of the Reach, preventing the motion from coming into law.
Faolan Reborn

When the Alessian Empire invaded the Reach, a prophesied child, said to unite the chiefs of the Reach and fight the Imperials, was found and named Faolan, "Red Eagle".
The Kings of the Reach who did not yet fall under the Imperial forces joined the Red Eagle, but even that was not enough.
Out of desperation, Faolan became the first Briarheart, and fought the Imperial forces by himself, killing hundreds of them until being killed.
Centuries later, the Reman Empire struck another blow, partitioning the Reach in two parts, awarded to Skyrim and High Rock.
Legends say that when the Reach was finally free, the sword of Faolan was to be brought to his corpse, so he could rise from the dead and lead his people.
[Root.GetTitledName] did so, and, infused with the spirit of the Briarhearts, was proclaimed Faolan reborn, the new Red Eagle.
We will never kneel again!
Reachmen Emperors sharing the Red Eagle's bloodline will be named Faolan, while Reachmen Empresses will be named Melka.

The Reach was without a king or unity for centuries, ever since the Red Eagle was defeated by the Imperial forces. But the Reachmen have found a new leader to follow, who united their lands with a flaming sword, forced the other powers of Tamriel to see them as equals, and some even say their chief struck an alliance with the Hagravens.\nAll of that made the Reachmen proclaim this chief as the new Red Eagle, as Faolan reborn.
The Hagravens Coven

As you place your offering, a dark figure emerge and approaches you.\n"Your dedication to the ancient rites has been noticed. Tell me, what do you seek? There must be something that you want, deep inside your heart. Is it power? Fame? Something else? We are powerful. There is much we can do."

As you place your offering, a dark figure emerge and approaches you.\n"It is quite unusual for a [Root.GetTitle] of the Reachmen to travel this far. Tell me, what do you seek? There must be something that you want, deep inside your heart. Is it power? Fame? Something else? We are powerful. There is much we can do."
I heard about your... Dark powers.
The Hagravens have many secrets. They could share some of them with you...
I am here to seek an alliance between the Reach and the Hagravens.
Some of the Reach leaders seeked an alliance with the Hagravens, as they are highly respected throughout the Reach. However, they will probably require... Something, in return.
There isn't anything I need, at least for now.

The Hagraven smiles and raise a hand.\n"Yes, we can offer that. As you know, countless warriors tried to give us their heart in exchange for powers. And countless witches asked us to teach them our secrets and turn them into what we are. But not all survived in the process. While it can give you untold powers and eternal life, you will suffer greatly in the process. And probably die. Are you sure you want this?"
I am.
The ceremony will put your body under extreme stress and pain. Your survival chance depends on your health.
Should you survive the process, you would be forced to stay a Hagraven cultist. Changing your religion would kill you.
That sounds a bit too dangerous...

The Hagraven raises a brow.\n"An alliance? They might call you '[Root.GetTitle] of the Reachmen', but the last one we truly followed was Faolan, after he traded his heart and bounded his then dark heart with Melka. Before we can talk about an alliance, you will need to offer your soul and body to our magic."

As you already have given your heart and soul to the Reach, I suppose the legacy of Faolan lives through you.\nThe Hagraven then raises a claw.\n"But Faolan did not just give his heart. He also binded his dark heart and soul to Melka, a Hagraven. Would you be ready to do the same, casting aside your mortal spouse if you have one?"
Take my heart and soul, make me a [Root.GetHagravenBriarheart].
I will bind myself to a [generated_briarheart_hagraven.GetHagravenBriarheart].
The High Crone will become your vassal.
An alliance with the Hagravens will be made.
The price might be too high.
You need 500 piety to go through the ceremony.
You need 1000 piety to go through the ceremony.
Hearts of thorn... bones of the wild... in life, Reachmen... rise from death, Blood of our Blood.
Beak, feathers, claws. Dark magic, limitless knowledge, savage powers. Your human form is weak, cast it aside and join the Hagravens.
My heart and soul for the Reach.
Faolan
Melka
The de Jure kingdom of the Reach doesn't exist.
